project_abstract.cdata: The Flood Emergency Recovery Project will assist the Government implement, and maintain macroeconomic stability, through the financing of import costs, associated with rebuilding social, and economic infrastructure, and, re-establish production levels in response to the damage caused by the recent floods, and cyclones. The project will provide immediate quick-disbursing finance for: 1) construction materials, electricity and fuel needed for rehabilitation of physical infrastructure, including the rehabilitation of transport, water, sanitation, power, and buildings, and recuperation of private enterprises; 2) agricultural inputs, equipment, and materials needed to re-establish agricultural outputs; 3) livestock, animal products, and veterinary medicines; 4) medical supplies, and equipment needed for health facilities damaged by the floods; 5) school supplies, and equipment to restore educational facilities damaged, or destroyed; and, 6) machinery, and equipment for commercial, and industrial companies. No disbursements will be made to cover luxury goods, nor military equipment. The credit will finance one hundred percent of the foreign costs of imports, and consultants, and eighty percent of the local costs of consultant services, including audits.
